page.title: 07ALL SAINTS PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Mentioned in the Domesday Book.The church building has been on this spot for more than 900 years.The tower is thought to have been built in the 14th or 15th century and has 6 bells.The font is Norman.The memorial stone pulpit was installed in 1879.The Nave is 59 feet long and is divided from the choir stalls and sanctuary by the carved wooden screen.The part underneath the tower was walled in during 1983 to provide a kitchen,an upstairs ante room,an office and toilets.There is an electrically pumped pipe organ with 2 manuals and pedals.The church is in need of restoration and an appeal is to be launched to raise 80,000 pounds.A recent Flower Festival raised about 1,100 pounds.
